hopobject.name: Page
hopobject.body: I'm sorry, he's buildingthefutureofhealth.eu This book seriously calls into question the value of all such large-scale bombing. When conducted in support of an army, it can often cause more harm than good: the devastation of Caen, France, for example, simply blocked the streets with rubble, making it impossible for the Allied armies to pass through. Likewise the Nazi bombing of Stalingrad created the perfect environment for urban guerrilla warfare, and arguably prevented the Wehrmacht from taking the city.
